newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile shares snap losing streak, end firm.
newsitem.headline: Chile shares snap losing streak, end firm.

text.p: Chilean shares on Tuesday closed firm for the first time in a week as an early surge on Wall Street helped bring out bargain hunters, traders said.
The rally could be short-lived. U.S. stocks slid late in the session, just as Chile's market was closing. That retreat is seen dragging down stocks at the opening, they said.
"I see stocks down in the morning, but they should stabilize in the afternoon," said Lance Eckel of brokerage Sud Americano.
The selective index ended up 1.34 percent at 107.8 points.
Endesa, a hydroelectric generator, ended up 3.91 percent at 239 pesos.
"Endesa's bouncing back, but there is uncertainty over fourth-quarter earnings," one trader said.
Investors are concerned Endesa's profits will be hurt by this year's drought, which forced the company to buy power on the expensive spot market.
The gainers on Tuesday included forestry company Masisa, up four percent at 208, and power utility Chilgener, which firmed 3.46 percent to 2,540 pesos.
Losers included telecom Entel, down 3.46 percent at 2,510 pesos, and pulpmaker Copec, which shed 0.61 percent to 1,60 pesos.
